me.aschwartz.cards

    Created by Andrew Schwartz on 4/9/17.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hand

        public Hand()
        Creates a new Hand. Not the preferred method for using/creating a Hand.
        This should not be used to create a new Hand.
        Instead, create a new Player object, then use Player.hand
        See Also:
        Player

    • Method Detail

      • hasBlackjack

        public boolean hasBlackjack()
        Determines whether or not the hand has Blackjack (an Ace and a 10 or face card)
        Returns:
        Boolean: true means the Hand does have blackjack, false means it does not.

      • hasTwentyOne

        public boolean hasTwentyOne()
        Determines if the sum of the value of the cards is 21
        Returns:
        Boolean: true if the value is 21.

      • isBusted

        public boolean isBusted()
        Determines whether or not a Hand is busted, in the context of Blackjack (21).
        Returns:
        Boolean: true, if the hand is busted.

      • getBlackjackTotal

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getBlackjackTotal()
        Gets the total for the Hand, in blackjack style.
        This returns a list of ints that include all of the possible options that a player can have, if they have an Ace.
        The lowest possibility is first, then highest is last.
        Returns:
        A list of possible values that a Hand could be worth in Blackjack, considering aces.

      • getMaxTotal

        public int getMaxTotal()
        Gets the largest possible value of a Hand, in Blackjack.
        While this does work for other games, getTotal() is more efficient.
        Returns:
        Highest possible value of a hand, in Blackjack.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints the Hand by printing each card adjacently inside of parenthesis.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String containing the list of each card in the Hand.

      • getTotal

        public int getTotal()
        Getter for total value of the Hand.
        Note that this should not be used for games like Blackjack since this values Queens as 12, Jacks as 11, etc.
        Aces are worth 1.
        For example, Q♥ = 12. A♣ = 1. 7♦ = 7.
        Returns:
        Int of the total value of the Hand.

      • getCards

        public java.util.ArrayList<Card> getCards()
        Gets the ArrayList cards of the Hand object.
        Returns:
        ArrayList<Card> list of cards in the Hand.
